title: Off to a bad start
text:
I‚Äôve only just finished setting up an account & already am running into major problems. 

The app asks for most recent company & initially, I typed in the business i worked for, but a list of 7 of the same business & logo with slight variations to the name popped up. I then typed in the management company & found it easily & selected it. Now realizing that was a mistake, the changes are irreversible. 

Firstly, in setting up the profile, it asks for most recent position, but not if that position is current. Now, after the profile is set up, it‚Äôs set to where I currently work for‚Ä¶ which not only isn‚Äôt the the right business, but also is not current. Yes, you can add additional information to complete the start/end dates, but you cannot change the name of the business.

I got this app, because I‚Äôve heard great things about it from many people, but now am hesitant to use it from fear of unintentionally displaying false information to prospective employers‚Ä¶ not a good way to start a new job. Fix your app & I‚Äôll be more inclined to use it & update my review/rating.

title: Paid for useless premium more times than I can count
text: Twice in the last four months I‚Äôve paid for premium and the algorithm is rubbish. In my feed, I get alerts for jobs where I‚Äôd be a top applicant in my field. I click on see more and the top applicant jobs are crazy and wildly varying. For example, General Manager at McDonalds to engineer for the federal government (both wrong). At $39.99 a month, it‚Äôs an awful amount of money to waste on an ineffective app. I‚Äôve tried logging in and logging out. I‚Äôve tried tweaking my job titles. Again, the recommended jobs in my news feed are spot on. But when the premium features (top applicant, etc) aren‚Äôt syncing up.

title: Linkedin app has become unusable
text: No, I don‚Äòt want to see 2 self-congratulating posts from pathetic linkedin influencers and 2 ads for every post from someone in my network I actually care about. Job search ridiculous, never shows jobs that actually fit the search term. Can‚Äòt wait to delete this as soon as I have found a new job.

title: Verification issues
text: I've already had my LinkedIn account verified. They have confirmed to me that my account has been successfully authenticated. Then why is the sing "verify now" displayed in my profile?

title: Negative Experience
text: Nowadays LinkedIn is so slow without using premium. That‚Äôs so disappointing and depressed job seekers. It‚Äôs now showing jobs which was posted two three or 10 months ago. This is very bad.

title: Stop manipulating and filtering reviewers
text: App asks for review and feedback and doesn‚Äôt send users here if they had feedback to share. Reviewers here don‚Äôt reflect reality.

title: Misinformation from employees
text: .Employees of LinkedIn post misinformation regularly. Report the post and LinkedIn say nothing is wrong when the information in the post is completely false. This platform is now about lies and censoring the truth. Completely worthless.

title: App crashes running iOS 17.4
text:
Just got a new iPhone 15 Pro Max running iOS 17.4, and having an issue where whenever I try and go to my profile page, the app freezes and I need to exit it. Other functions such as jobs, notifications etc seem to work. I already tried deleting the app and reinstalling. No luck. 

Read in several online forums that this has been an ongoing issue for many for over a year now.

title: Fixed
text: Was having an issue with the copy and paste response scrips but finally got my page back.

title: Suggested posts
text: These new suggested posts are THE ABSOLUTE WORST!!!!. I‚Äôd rather watch paint dry then read my LinkedIn feeds suggested posts. I live in American and I keep getting shown random posts by people in India and on topics I care nothing about. The team who built it should be embarrassed

title: Woah
text: My one star rating is in no way reflected by the funtionality of the app itself- I deleted the app after it finished downoading so I have no idea. My rating is just for the privacy policy. It shows that for many purposes- one of which being titled ‚Äòother‚Äô- that the app may collect data from your phone. Normal to an extent, but it mentions pictures, videos, emails, text messages- the list goes on. There is no reason in my mind that would make sense to release that to anyone- let alone an app- to use a service. I‚Äôve got nothing ‚Äòillegal, immoral, or incriminating of me or others‚Äô to hide on my phone, but I do have a lot of sensitive and personal things, like conversations etc. like everyone else.

title: Too Many Ads
text:

4)Scroll bar on the job description is very hard to find as it merge with job description background color, need to change scroll bar color .5) Every job post should have Easy Apply option .
6) Need a new option as Auto Apply for a job 
7) LinkedIn should restrict the all job posts to have easy apply option only.
8) need a filter to exclude consultancies in job search , this will reduce efforts to find the fulltime job opportunities from FTE companies 
9) need dark mode option

title: Viewing applicant resumes - broken
text: Ability to view applicants resumes (both pdfs and docs) is broken in the app. It makes it difficult for hiring managers to use the app.

title: Honestly just a joke
text:
This sums it up, ‚Äú Finally. After a solid year of being unemployed, not for want of trying, I have secured a job. And a good one at that. A big thank you to a particular member of my personal network, you know who you are and I couldn't have done it without you.
With that said, I have something else to say.
I learned a valuable lesson during this experience. And that is only my real-life connections matter. Networking the corporate way, the Linkedin way, is as thin and as artificial as plastic. This website combines the two worst aspects of modern life, vapid corporate culture and the mind-poison of social media. And what it purported to provide in turn, it doesn't. At least not in my experience and in the words of others online who report the exact same things.
There was the promise of employment opportunities, but even on this platform users acknowledge hiring is sparse at best. Valuable personal networks were another prospect, but being real or yourself is strongly advised against, instead they insist you wear a bland, white-washed mask and follow a generic, unoffensive script, just like everyone else. They insisted you need it to get ahead in your career, but that also doesn't seem to be reality, just a reflection of the vain hope that engagement on this site makes you a 'thought leader', an
'influencer' or a similar drivel-spewer and that, somehow, this will translate into promotions and success.
This site only exists to sell false hope and resume services.
So, I have decided to delete my Linkedin account. I wish I could say it was a tough decision I deliberated hours and hours on, but that would be a lie. By the time any of you read this, it'll be gone. And good riddance.
Since you denizens of this site seem to rather like quotes, here's one from the great Billy Joel:
"And it seems such a waste of time. If that's what it's all about. Mama, if that's movin' up, then I'm... movin' out."
You can keep your wasteland of ghost jobs, brain-dead 'leadership' quotes, advertisements masquerading as posts, and people who apparently live in the office insisting you should never take vacations, sick days, or weekends, I'm out!‚Äù

title: Stop adding images and reviews to jobs
text: You‚Äôre doing too much UX design and it‚Äôs making the app slow and hard to use. Aesthetics are nice but functionality is way more important.

title: I can't use the app
text: I can't use the app. The application asks for an update and does not work. When updating in the AppStore, the application cannot be updated; a new version of iOS is needed. I'm not going to update iOS just for this. Why not leave the ability to use the application on older versions of iOS? Everything worked great, who cares?

title: Super slow and Lag
text: The app has been super laggy and slow when loading jobs and in web view. It froze when I tried to type and apply submit an application. The content also flashes and blinks when scrolling. Performance has been so bad. You guys need to fix it.

text: Totally worthless app.  Continually bugs you to sign up for paid services which will never happen.  If you can‚Äôt provide a decent free product why should I pay?  I only see 4-5 posts and that‚Äôs it.  No way to see more.  Bots galore on comments to posts.  Dumpster fire app.

title: Pay to use
text: When I had the free trial, I never got notifications about being top applicant in jobs or who viewed my profile. Now that my trial has ended (and I can‚Äôt afford to pay money to look for jobs), I get tons of notifications about how I would be top applicant in these jobs and how these people viewed my profile BUT to see them, you have to pay. Crazy sales tactic that has made me look at other job sites honestly.

title: Problematic with no support!
text: Downloaded the app, set up my account using sensitive information including a drivers license, worked great for the first day! Since then (about 2-3 weeks) I have been locked out after being asked to verify my phone number for 2 step authentication! Tells me my daily limit has been reached day after day! There is no customer support email in the app prior to logging in to be able to email about this issue, no email for customer support on the website and of course no phone number to call anywhere for help. If my login situation can‚Äôt be remedied, please advise on how to reach someone to delete my account and all information collected up to this point!

title: Profile verification system flawed
text: LinkedIn needs to fix an important flaw in its system - it urges US citizens based in other countries to verify their identity using Persona, a system which does not offer verification for US passports. This is a really big oversight, and it's super annoying getting hit constantly with nudges to do something that is impossible for me to do because of a system flaw.
